title: Introduction to React Hooks
shortDescription: Learn the fundamentals of React Hooks and how they revolutionize state management in functional components.
longDescription: This comprehensive introduction covers the core concepts of React Hooks, including useState, useEffect, and custom hooks. You'll learn how to manage state and side effects in functional components, making your React code more readable and maintainable.

levels.title: Understanding useState Hook
levels.summary: Learn how to use useState to manage state in functional components
keyPoints: useState replaces this.setState in functional components
Always returns a stateful value and a setter function
Can handle primitive values and objects

items.prompt: What does the useState hook return?

options.text: A stateful value and a setter function
A state object and updater function

items.explanation: useState always returns an array with exactly two elements: the current state value and a function to update it.

items.prompt: Describe a scenario where useState would be more appropriate than using a class component with this.state.
items.guidance: Think about component simplicity, readability, and modern React patterns.

items.message: Great! You now understand the basics of useState. Let's move on to managing side effects.
items.actionHint: Ready to learn about useEffect? Continue to the next section.

levels.title: Managing Side Effects with useEffect
levels.summary: Master the useEffect hook for handling side effects in functional components
keyPoints: Dependency array controls when effect runs
Can run after every render or selectively

items.prompt: When does useEffect run with an empty dependency array []?
items.explanation: An empty dependency array tells React to run the effect only once, similar to componentDidMount.

items.message: Excellent! You understand how useEffect works with dependencies.

levels.title: Creating Custom Hooks
levels.summary: Learn to build your own reusable hooks for shared logic
keyPoints: Can call other hooks inside custom hooks

items.prompt: What is a key benefit of custom hooks?
items.explanation: Custom hooks allow you to extract and reuse stateful logic between components without changing component hierarchy.

items.prompt: Describe a custom hook you would create for a real-world application and what problem it would solve.
items.placeholder: Think about common patterns in your apps...
items.guidance: Consider authentication, data fetching, form handling, or UI state patterns.

items.message: Congratulations! You've completed the introduction to React Hooks.
items.actionHint: Ready to build your first hook-based component?
